zone.line: Spirit of Beauty, at whose soft command
The sunbeams & the showers distil sweet foizon
From the Earths bosom chill!
O bid those beams be each a blinding brand
Of lightening! bid those showers be dews of poison
Bid the Earth's plenty kill!
Bid thy bright Heaven above,
While light & darkness bound it,
tomb
Be their grave, who planneed
To make it ours & thine!
Or, with thine harmonizing ardours fill
And raise thy sons, as o'er the prone horizon
Thy lamp feeds every western wave with fire.
Be Man's high hope, & unextinct desire
Thee instrument to work thy will divine!
Then, clouds from sunbeams, antelopes from
leopards,
And frowns & fears from Thee,
Shall not more swiftly flee
Than Celtic wolves from the Ausonian
shepherds
Whatever, Spirit, from thy sphered shrine
Thou yieldest or witholdest, yet let be
This City of thy worship, ever free!
